channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: People littering the streets. Rubbish bags left out in the road long before collection is due., 8th November
item.description:
Near 52 Sandringham Road. Litter is strewn across the street often. People leave piles of rubbish everywhere. It is a hazard for my child and dog. One culprit is Claudia Defosse of 15B Sandringham Road, as I had seen her name in the rubbish.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sandringham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner of Coverdale Road and Willesden Ln, 8th November
item.description:
Hazards on the street including a road red cone, sacks of dirt and sand which are dangerous for pedestrians including people with disabilities passing by and risking to trip and fall. This has been there for more than a year. How hard is it to remove? We pay taxes for this!!!! How hard is it fix?!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Coverdale Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin and dumped rubbish - footpath leading to footbridge - 39-40 Chatsworth Parade, Petts Wood, BR5 1DE, 8th November
item.description:
Overflowing public bin and dumped rubbish by the bin on the footpath leading to the railway footbridge from the rear of the car park next to Mortimer House - 39-40 Chatsworth Parade, Petts Wood, BR5 1DE. Please can the bin be emptied and surrounding litter cleared - thank you. Due to the works at Petts Wood Station, there is currently no through route across the station footbridge. Therefore, most pedestrians travelling between the two sides of Petts Wood have to use this footpath, meaning it has much higher footfall than usual. This means that this bin is filling up much faster than normal, and regularly overflows. It would therefore be great if you could arrange for this bin to be emptied more frequently while the works at Petts Wood Station are ongoing. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queensway, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disabled Parking Bay, 8th November
item.description:
The bay was originally assigned to a resident at 17 Heverham Road who has sadly passed away and it’s no longer in use. I’d like to request that the council reviews this space and considers removing or returning it to standard public parking, as it’s currently unused and still marked as a disabled bay.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heverham Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Curved, damaged barrier, 8th November
item.description:
I leave on Naylor Road more than 1,5 years and I notice some problems with the barrier on the pavement. This old metal, damaged barrier has sharp ends and also obstruct parking plot. The parking space can not be use as the barrier obstruct the space to open the car door and might cause the damages to the vehicle. Would be possible to remove it as it does not have any reason to be there, it does not protect anything and it is dangerous for public. Please see the pictures. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-32, Naylor Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public toilet lesnes abbey, 8th November
item.description:
We visited lesnes a bey with my 82 year old father today after a walk in the woods. With expectation this would be suitable day out as there are public toilets next to the cafe. The toilets were locked shut at 1.30pm lunchtime with a ig padlock. No sign of employees. My dad had to use the woods to relieve himself as he is elderly and coukd not wait. The public toilets have a sign stating that they are open every day in november from 9am to 5pm. There was no explanation why the toilets were shut.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
